title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Aluminum futures have surged above $3,000 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, the highest in over three years, due to tightening global supply and strong demand from construction and renewable energy. Challenges include China’s efforts to curb overcapacity, high energy costs, and smelter disruptions in Iceland, Mozambique, and Australia. The Aluminum Association urges stronger USMCA enforcement against subsidized Chinese aluminum imports.

title: Aluminum price forecast for 2026, according to BCA Research
summary: Aluminum prices remain resilient short-term due to constrained Chinese primary production nearing its 45 million metric tonne capacity cap. Demand is supported by substitution from copper in electrical applications amid a wide price spread. However, BCA Research expects fading supports in 2026 as global manufacturing weakens and secondary production rises.

title: The 2026 Aluminum Squeeze: Why This Industrial Metal is Outperforming the S&P 500
summary: A structural price squeeze grips the global aluminum market as of mid-January 2026, driven by supply bottlenecks including Guinea's bauxite processing shift and China's 45 million tonne production ceiling. Chinese exports fell 9% in late 2025 amid domestic green economy demand. Future scenarios include potential demand destruction above $3,200/tonne or relief from Russian supply if sanctions ease.

title: U.S. aluminum prices hit record highs amid tariffs, low supply
summary: U.S. aluminum prices reach record highs due to Trump's 50% tariffs, tight global supply, and low inventories below 300,000 tons from 750,000 at start of 2025. The Midwest premium hit 96 cents per pound ($2,116/ton), far above justified costs, as exporters diverted to Europe and Canadian shipments slowed. This raises costs for automotive, aerospace, packaging, and construction industries.

title: Aluminum prices top $3000 for the first time since 2022 as supply risks grow
summary: Global aluminum prices have surged to $3,000 per tonne, the highest since 2022, driven by China's production cap and rising demand in key sectors. Supply risks from various global factors contribute to the rally.

title: CBAM starts in January 2026, with limited aluminium impact until Q1
summary: The EU's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) begins in January 2026, pricing carbon on imports like aluminum to support EU industries. Aluminum supply disruptions are expected to remain muted through Q1, with potential shifts from April.

title: Aluminum Sector 2026: Strategic Plays in a Supply-Constrained World
summary: Alcoa emerges as a key player in the supply-constrained aluminum sector through vertical integration, decarbonization expertise, and innovations like ELYSIS™ and ASTRAEA™ that eliminate direct greenhouse gas emissions. A 10-year renewable energy deal with NYPA and $60M smelter modernization enhance its green aluminum production. Circular economy initiatives position Alcoa to meet rising demand for low-carbon credentials.

title: Paragon Union-Japan's Asahi Seiren to tap RM648b recycled aluminium market
summary: Paragon Union and Japan's Asahi Seiren partner to enter the RM648b recycled aluminum market. Recycled aluminum production uses just 5% of the energy required for primary production and cuts greenhouse gas emissions by up to 95%. This addresses key sustainability challenges in the industry.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 942 USD/T on January 13, 2026, down 0.11% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.86%, and are up 33.24% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts indicate trading at 959.80 USD/T by quarter-end and 1032.31 USD/T in 12 months.

title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, reached 1.752 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.7 percent, up 2.8 percent from the prior week. This marks a 3.1 percent increase from the same week in 2025. Year-to-date production through January 10 is up 2.6 percent from last year.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Nucor, the largest U.S. steel producer, kept hot-rolled coil prices stable in late December 2025 after nine weeks of increases, providing temporary market stability. Vendors report extended lead times of five to six weeks due to demand. Globally, China's steel exports rose 6.7% through November 2025, while India imposed tariffs on steel imports.

title: Metal Market Update: Steel & Aluminum Prices Heading Into 2026
summary: Steel prices are increasing into Q1 2026 due to mill maintenance, Nippon/US Steel acquisition, coating extras, and tariffs. Sheffield Metals announces price hikes effective mid-to-late January amid stretching lead times and inventory refills. Factors like Q4 shutdowns and upgrades are driving costs higher.

title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, reached 1.752 million net tons, up 2.8 percent from the previous week and 3.1 percent from the same week in 2025. The capacity utilization rate was 75.7 percent, compared to 74.4 percent the prior week and 76.3 percent a year earlier. Adjusted year-to-date production through January 10 was 2.482 million net tons at 75.3 percent utilization, up 2.6 percent year-over-year.

title: Global steel industry battles surplus supply, protectionism
summary: Global steelmaking capacity is projected to reach 2.55 billion metric tons by end-2025, with a 2025 surplus of 680 million mt, exacerbated by additions in Asia and the Middle East. India anticipates producing 11.4 million mt more crude steel in 2026, aiming for 300 million mt capacity by 2030 amid weakening prices. Protectionist measures, like US 50% steel tariffs, intensify challenges for Europe and global trade.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel Industry
summary: Fujitsu has started a demonstration experiment on green steel value flow using blockchain, selected by Japan's METI for its FY2025 project, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The initiative ensures secure distribution of environmental value data, like emissions reduction certificates, across steel supply chains via CO2 reduction expertise and data platforms. It addresses challenges in propagating green steel's benefits downstream to promote decarbonization.

title: Signal Group Spotlight: Steel Seaborne Trends
summary: The start of 2026 is expected to feature a seasonal dip in steel production due to Chinese New Year holidays, impacting exports with weaker Q1 volumes. This trend follows historical patterns of reduced activity during the holiday period.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel industry
summary: Fujitsu has commenced a demonstration experiment into green steel value flow using blockchain technology, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The project, selected by Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI), aims to ensure environmental value and transaction confidentiality are secured across steel supply chains while exploring mechanisms for green steel information distribution.

title: Codelco Raises Copper Production Expectations, LME Copper Fluctuates and Closes Lower Overnight - SMM Copper Morning Meeting
summary: Codelco has raised its copper production expectations amid market fluctuations. Overnight LME copper opened at $13,185.5/mt, hit a high of $13,313.5/mt and a low of $13,105/mt, closing at $13,156/mt, down 0.12%. Shanghai SHFE copper showed a V-shape pattern, closing at 103,160 yuan/mt, while Guangdong spot premiums rose slightly.

title: Copper surges past $13,000/t as bull run gains pace
summary: The three-month LME copper price closed at $13,230/t, up 3.04% on the day and 5.8% since January 2, driven by investor flight to safe-haven assets amid geopolitical uncertainty. Supply concerns intensified with Chinese smelters planning to cut utilization by 10% due to low TC/RCs and a benchmark settlement at $0/t. Prices rose sharply late last year on interest rate cuts, US shipments, and expected copper concentrate shortfalls of 650,000–850,000t in 2026.

title: Copper prices hit yet another record on supply and tariff fears
summary: LME three-month copper rose 1.8% to $13,225/t after hitting an all-time high of $13,387.50, up 6.6% in 2026 so far following a 42% surge in 2025. Drivers include supply disruptions like a strike at Capstone Copper’s Mantoverde mine and delays at Tongling’s Mirador mine, plus US tariff fears drawing metal into the country. While AI and energy transition boost long-term demand, some traders question if speculative inflows outpace fundamentals.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Copper hit a record high to start 2026, opening at $6.01/lb amid strong demand from data centers and renewables outpacing supply due to mining disruptions. In December 2025, prices surged after China's growth priority announcement and US stockpiling. Analysts foresee short-term volatility from weak Chinese demand but long-term rises toward $7/lb, with 27 copper wire price increases noted.

title: 3 reasons why copper prices are surging
summary: Copper prices rose 52% from $8,700/t in early 2025 to over $13,000/t in January 2026, driven by mine supply disruptions at Kamoa-Kakula and Grasberg, financial speculation with elevated futures positioning, and US inventory stockpiling ahead of potential 15-30% tariffs from 2027. Comex inventories rose 300kt since April 2025, creating a premium over LME prices. Prices trade 121% above marginal cost, historically signaling poor long-term returns despite short-term gains.

title: Copper hits new peak as supply concerns outweigh dollar strength
summary: Benchmark LME three-month copper advanced 1.55% to $13,367.5/t by 0340 GMT, retreating slightly from a new record, as supply concerns outweighed a firmer dollar.

title: Copper drifts higher on supply concerns
summary: Copper prices edged higher on Tuesday amid supply worries and speculator interest, offset by a slightly firmer dollar.

title: Codelco Raises Copper Production Expectations, LME Copper Fluctuates and Closes Lower Overnight - SMM Copper Morning Meeting
summary: Codelco's Chairman Maximo Pacheco announced that the company's copper production is expected to reach 1.344 million mt in 2026, up 10,000 mt from 2025's 1.33 million mt, with December 2025 output at 170,000 mt. The company also cooperated with others to produce 100,000 mt of copper. Overnight LME copper futures closed at $13,156/mt, down 0.12%, amid fluctuations and falling inventories providing fundamental support.

title: Chile's Codelco expects to lift copper output by 10,000 tons this year
summary: Chilean state-run miner Codelco expects to produce 1.344 million metric tons of copper in 2026, an increase of about 10,000 tons from the previous year. This projection highlights efforts to boost output from the world's largest copper producer.

title: Copper To Become the Global Economy's Most Critical Asset in 2026
summary: Global copper markets face a projected deficit of hundreds of thousands of tonnes in 2026 due to underinvestment in new mines, supply disruptions, and declining ore grades. Critically low inventories amplify spot-market sensitivity, with limited near-term supply elasticity as new projects take 7-10 years to develop. Market consensus points to a structural deficit amid accelerating demand.

title: Driving innovation at Escondida
summary: BHP's Escondida copper mine in Chile has achieved full autonomy at its Escondida Norte pit, operating 33 autonomous trucks and 11 autonomous drills that move over 350,000 tonnes of material daily. The autonomous zone now accounts for 30% of Escondida's production and has trained over 5,000 workers in new technologies while maintaining 64% female participation in autonomy-related roles. These innovations enhance safety, productivity, and sustainability while positioning the world's largest copper producer to meet growing global demand driven by electrification and renewable energy.

title: Copper in the Age of AI: Challenges of Electrification
summary: S&P Global's comprehensive study projects global copper demand will rise 50% to 42 million metric tons by 2040 from 28 million metric tons in 2025, driven by electrification, renewable energy, data centers, and AI infrastructure. The report identifies a potential 10 million metric ton shortfall by 2040 without significant supply expansion and emphasizes that copper has become essential to technological progress and economic growth. The analysis highlights the need for multilateral cooperation, regional diversification, and innovation across the entire copper value chain to ensure a resilient supply system.

title: SMM Nickel Midday Review - Nickel Prices Continued to Rise
summary: SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 146,450 yuan/mt on January 14, up 1,250 yuan/mt from the previous trading day. The most-traded SHFE nickel contract closed at 143,160 yuan/mt, up 1.47%, amid a tug-of-war between strong expectations for Indonesian policies and weak demand fundamentals. The market is expected to remain volatile within a 128,000-145,000 yuan/mt range.

title: LME Nickel Prices Surge Toward $17,900 on Weaker US Dollar
summary: London Metal Exchange nickel futures rose by $185 on January 12, nearing the $17,900 level after a two-day increase. This reflects continued strength in nickel prices driven by macroeconomic factors and currency movements.

title: Mysteel: China Dec lithium-ion battery materials production
summary: Indonesia's nickel matte production for January 2026 is projected at 41,700 tonnes in Ni content, up 13.76% MoM and 31.82% YoY. China's nickel sulfate production in January 2026 is expected to reach 47,600 tonnes in Ni content, increasing 5.04% MoM amid rising nickel prices due to concerns over tighter Indonesian quotas.

title: Nickel reaches 14-month high following Vale Indonesia's halt to mining
summary: Nickel prices hit a 14-month high after Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to delays in approving its annual production plan. This surge follows Indonesia's announcement to cut ore production by a third by 2026 to support prices, amid prior oversupply concerns.

title: SunSirs: Last Week, Nickel Prices Rose Initially and Then Fell (January 5-9)
summary: Nickel prices fluctuated last week, rising initially due to Indonesia's planned 34% cut in nickel ore production quotas for 2026, then falling. Refined nickel production in China is expected to decrease month-on-month, narrowing short-term surplus amid abundant overall supply.

title: Indonesia may slash nickel output to steady prices
summary: Indonesia, the top nickel producer, proposes reducing 2026 production by 34% to 250 million tonnes from this year's levels to prevent further price declines. The plan, cited by the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association, awaits final implementation details.

title: Nickel prices surge as Indonesia mine suspension tightens supply
summary: Nickel prices surged after Vale Indonesia suspended mining operations due to delays in 2026 work plan approvals. The suspension highlights tightening supply amid Indonesia's broader production quota adjustments.

title: Sherritt-Canada's Nickel Mines in Cuba Need Oil to Operate
summary: Sherritt's nickel mining operations in Cuba rely on Venezuelan oil supplies. Disruptions to this oil could impact production capacity at these mines.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for electric vehicles and green energy. The project utilizes the innovative DNi Process, which extracts nickel and cobalt from laterite ore with over 98% nitric acid recycling, no tailings dams, and minimal waste, ensuring sustainability. Once operational, it will be a carbon-negative facility supplying nickel chemicals to the EV and energy storage industries.
